Topic.Title: Romney's tax plan crunches middle class

Message.Msg: The editorial you cite looks like Repub screed. It posits that taxes would have to go up on someone to make the plan pay for itself. Reality is that the plan would never pay for itself and Repub tax policies will only increase the deficit. If Mitt Romney wins, you can watch with your own eyes as the deficit widens. Republicans have this magical thinking that says that if you cut taxes, it will spur so much growth that revenues will increase. Such laissez faire economic policies lead to boom-and-bust cycles like we saw in 1987 and 2008. Another problem with GOP policies is they increase budget deficits as happened under Reagan and Bush 2. They cannot be trusted with a budget even more than Democrats cannot be trusted. Neither major party is ready for serious budget reform.

Topic.Title: Romney's tax plan crunches middle class

Message.Msg: Neither the republicans or the democrats have a plan, the leadership or the courage to avert the coming economic Armageddon. The US economy is speeding at 1000 mph towards a financial concrete wall. The Great Depression and subsequent World War will look like a Sunday school picnic compared to the fast approaching economic devastation . Kyle Bass, the man who accurately predicted the collapse of the housing bubble, recently advised buying gold and GUNS. Yes, the coming economic collapse is going to be that horrific! While ebayanalphabeticmale polly parrots his brainless Ed Shultz political dogma and the defenders of Romney as the excellent manager of the USA's decine engage in meaningless idiotic debate the country gains speed on journey to economic oblivion. Try to get your heads wrapped around what you can do to prevent the certain coming economic collapse because it is something you both have in common. Cease this non-brainy meaningless discourse.

Topic.Title: Romney's tax plan crunches middle class

Message.Msg: I totally agree with your point here, and recced it, but I don't know who Ed Shultz is (might have read him somewhere) I certainly don't parrot his, or anyone else's words. I simply find fact and discuss to the facts, although I see personal attacks are the way "discussion" seems handled up here. I agree neither candidate for President, and almost no other lesser politicians have a plan on the coming storm because they are owned lock stock and barrel by the profiteers causing said storm. Some of these groups, like Goldman Sachs, think they can somehow profit by turning society inside out. Just for the sake of discussion: 1. Offshore cash. It's going to be worthless too, and can one access it in troubled times? And send it where? 2. Gold. Shiny and fun, but you can't eat it. Are the gangs that take over after the storm going to simply trade for a piece or two, or jack somebody for the whole stash? 3. Guns. Can't eat them either. If in the right place maybe one can hunt with them, but families still need other food, and game will be scarce when everyone is after it. Plus the fires and pollution has already lowered wildlife. As for protection, watch any zombie movie to see how well one guy and gun, or lot of them, fairs in rough situations. Treasures on Earth may not be the way out of this one folks.

Topic.Title: Romney's tax plan crunches middle class

Message.Msg: Ok, I'll try this one more time Agqut because you seem to be of the 'attack and innuendo' school of debating. First off, I agree with your central premise, and rest assured, I am well versed on every kind of weapon. Anyone who says gold is easily transportable hasn't had more than 10k of it. Yes, history shows it can be a hedge, but not always for the little guy. The sight of it will interest gangs and governments of your presense and survival. Same with guns. They can only go so far. To use your analogy on Somalia (and "kuddos" on the needless innuendo of equating my ID with the punks, not alphas, of Somalia). Wade into that crowd of war lords with your gun to protect you and barter a piece of that gold for food, water, or anything else needed and see how it goes. Myself, I'm hedging with much of the above, and a sweet piece of land (if I can get to it in time and keep it) and my friends, because the quality of friends in the coming times will be the ultimate survival resource. PS: 1. The evidence shows the powers that be want a crash. They think they'll profit by it. 2. Only people with no reading skills think I'm a Democrat, who are only a shade better than the completely corrupt and conniving Regubs. And 3. I'm going to need to see a link on that stoning of Caddilacs because I think that's as made up as the "spitting on returning Nam vets" myth.
